Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Cup
Description: Wheel-made vase made from a buff-coloured clay with an organic temper. The flat base was cut with a string. The decoration consists of two perpendicular white-painted lines and a few patches of the same paint. There are also traces of white paint on the inner lip. Large black burnt marks were possibly made during firing or in in a blaze (possibly an unsuccessfully made vessel).
